The Best Video Editing Software for Motion Tracking Motion tracking is an impressive effect that's available in most pro-level and some consumer-level video editing software. It lets you attach an object or effect to something moving in your video. For example, you might use this editing tool to place a blur over the face of someone you don't want revealed in your video or to display a text box next to a moving object. You mark the object you want to track, specify the effect or text, and let the app follow the marked object. Pro-level software like DaVinci Resolve and Premiere Pro also do motion tracking, and they support plug-ins and ancillary applications with even more capabilities. Does Editing Software Support 4K and 8K Video? Support for 4K video source content has become fairly standard in video editing software, and pro software already supports up to 8K and sometimes even higher. However, this isn't really practical unless you're running a full-size movie theater. That said, even smartphones like the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra can now shoot in 8K. (Credit: Corel/PCMag) Support for 4K and higher formats varies among the consumer products. For example, some but not all the applications can import Sony XAVC and XAVC-S formats, which Sony's popular DSLRs, mirrorless cameras, camcorders, and professional video cameras use. The same is true for the H.265 High Efficiency Video Coding (HEVC) standard. Most of the applications here now can import and export HEVC, but there are still a few holdouts. If you plan on working with 4K or higher video content, make sure you choose a video editing application that can render output files quickly (see the section on speed testing below). Support for newer formats, such as the open-source AV1 and the even more efficient H.266 (VVC‚ÄîVersatile Video Coding), is very limited at this point. Furthermore, none of the apps here supports H.266. Happily, several of them do support importing Google's WebM format. The Best Video Editing Software for Multicam Advanced abilities continue to make their way into accessible, affordable, and consumer-friendly video editing apps as each new generation of software is released. Multicam editing, which lets you switch camera angles for the same scene shot with multiple video cameras, used to be a feature only for professional software. This and many other advanced effects are now available in enthusiast-level programs. CyberLink PowerDirector excels at multicam editing, as do the pro-level applications DaVinci Resolve, Premiere Pro, and Final Cut Pro. Can You Edit Video on a Smartphone? You can create and edit videos on mobile devices almost as easily as you can watch them. If you're making videos for social media, you might even prefer to edit on a phone. Many of the desktop applications on this list of the best video editing apps also have mobile video editing apps. (Credit: Adobe/PCMag) One capability that has arrived in consumer-level video editing software is color grading. Color wheels, curves, and histograms give editors control over the intensity of every shade. Another important tool you find in some applications is color matching. If you shoot videos with multiple cameras and in different lighting conditions, you should make sure your video editing software has good color-matching capability for a consistent look. You may also want an application that supports producing HDR content, since that's now available on many TVs. LUTs (lookup tables), also known as CLUTs (color lookup tables), are powerful color editing tools. This staple of pro-level software lets you quickly change the look of a video to give it a specific mood. For example, think of the dark blue look of thriller movies like The Revenant. You can download LUTs for free from several sites or use those included with video software to give your video a specific look. One well-known LUT type is the kind that can make a daytime scene look like it was shot at night, known in moviemaking as day for night. Corel VideoStudio also includes 3D titling, though it's not as powerful as Apple's. Captions for dialogue are another type of text you may want to overlay on your video. Several of the programs now have auto-captioning that takes dialogue from your video clips and produces a caption file. The next step is appearing in the applications, too: letting you edit using the text captions. This capability started in Premiere Pro and most recently has landed in PowerDirector. What Are the Fastest Video Editors? Video editing is one of the most computing-intensive activities. It pays to have the best laptop or desktop you can afford if you're serious about cutting your own movies. Most applications help speed up the editing process by creating a proxy file of lower resolution so that huge, full-resolution files don't slow down normal editing and previewing. Particularly intensive is rendering the finished product into a standard video file that is playable on the target device of choice, whether it's a TV, laptop, or smartphone. Most software can speed up by taking advantage of your computer's graphics processor. Be sure to check the performance section in each review linked here to see how speedy or slow the application is. For render speed testing, I have each program join seven clips of various resolutions ranging from 720p all the way up to 8K and then apply cross-dissolve transitions between them. I then note the time it takes to render the project to 1080p30 with H.264 at 16Mbps and 192Kbps audio. The output movie is just over five minutes in length. I tested on a Windows 11 PC sporting a 3.60GHz Intel Core i7-12700K, 16GB RAM, an Nvidia GeForce RTX 3060 Ti, and a 512GB Samsung PM9A1 PCIe 4.0 NVMe SSD. Other measures of performance include startup time and simple stability. Again, video editing is a taxing activity for any computer, involving many components. In the past, video editing programs took longer than most other apps to start up, and unexpected shutdowns were unfortunately common, even in top apps from top developers such as Adobe and Apple. The stability situation has greatly improved, but the complexity of the process only increases as these editors gain more powerful effects. As such, they are likely never fully immune to crashes, which often raise their ugly heads after a feature update. What's the Best Free Video Editing Software? However, creating high-quality content for YouTube requires a significant amount of time, effort, and expertise. One crucial aspect of creating engaging videos is the editing process. While professional video editing services have been around for a long time, the rise of AI video editing has raised questions about which is the best option for YouTube creators. In this article, we will compare and contrast AI video editing and professional video editing services to help you decide which one is best for your YouTube channel. What is an AI video editing tool? AI video editing tools use artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms to automatically edit videos. These tools can perform tasks like trimming footage, color correction, and even suggest creative editing options. These AI video editing tools typically use deep learning techniques to analyze video data. This involves training neural networks on large datasets of video footage, allowing them to recognize patterns and make predictions about the content of new video clips. For example, an AI video editing tool might be trained to recognize specific types of objects, such as cars or people, and use this information to automatically generate cutaway shots or close-ups. Some of the specific features and capabilities offered by AI video editing tools may include: Automatic AI video editing AI video editing tools can analyze video footage and automatically generate a rough cut of the content, eliminating the need for manual editing when it comes to video creation. Object and face detection AI video editing tools can recognize specific objects and faces in a video clip and use this information to perform editing tasks, such as adding text or applying special effects. Speech recognition AI video editing tools can transcribe spoken words in a video clip and use this information to generate captions or subtitles. Color correction AI video editing tools can analyze the color balance and tone of a video clip and make automatic adjustments to improve the visual quality. Scene analysis AI video editing tools can analyze the content of a video clip and automatically identify key scenes, allowing for easy organization and management of large video libraries. Overall, AI video editing tools offer a powerful set of capabilities for automating and enhancing the video editing process. While they may not completely replace human editors, they can save time and improve efficiency for a wide range of video production tasks. How do AI video editing tools work? AI video editing tools work by analyzing the video content and identifying patterns and features that can be edited. For example, they can detect changes in lighting or sound and automatically adjust the color or volume levels. Additionally, AI video editing tools can use natural language processing to understand the content of the video and suggest edits based on the context. For example, if your YouTube video is about cooking, the tool might suggest adding captions or text overlays to highlight the recipe steps. AI video editing tools are often integrated with popular video editing software like Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, and DaVinci Resolve, making them easy to use for both amateur and professional editors. They can help save time, reduce errors, and improve the overall quality of video content. Benefits of using an AI video editing tool Time-saving: One of the primary benefits of using an AI video editing tool is that it can significantly reduce the time required to edit a video. Instead of spending hours manually editing footage, an AI video editing tool can perform many of the tasks automatically, allowing you to focus on other aspects of your video production. Consistency: AI video editor tools can ensure consistency in your video content by applying the same edits across multiple videos. This can be particularly useful for brands that need to maintain a consistent visual identity across their video content. Cost-effective: AI video editing tools can be more cost-effective than hiring a professional video editor. Many of these tools are available for a low monthly subscription fee, making them accessible to small businesses and individual content creators. Automated editing: AI video editing tools can perform many of the repetitive and time-consuming tasks involved in video editing, such as trimming footage or adjusting color. This can help you to focus on the more creative aspects of video production. Limitations of AI video editing tools Lack of creativity: While AI video editing software can perform many of the basic editing tasks on your video clip, they lack the creativity and nuance of a human editor. They may not be able to make complex editing decisions or come up with new and innovative editing options. Limited customization: AI video editing tools are limited by the algorithms they are programmed with. This means that they may not be able to make edits that are specific to your brand or content. Reliance on quality source material: AI video editing tools require high-quality source material in order to produce good results. If the footage is poorly shot or the sound quality is low, the tool may not be able to make significant improvements. Limited control: Using an AI video editing tool means relinquishing some control over the final product. While the tool may suggest edits based on the content, you may still need to make additional adjustments to achieve the desired outcome. What is a Professional Video Editing Service? A Professional Video Editing Service is a service provided by a professional video editor who uses their skills and expertise to edit your video content. This is in contrast to AI video editing tools which use algorithms and artificial intelligence to perform video editing work. How does a Professional Video Editing Service work? When using a Professional Video Editing Service, you typically send your YouTube video footage to the editor along with any specific editing instructions or preferences. The editor then applies their professional knowledge and skills to edit the footage to achieve the desired outcome. The video editing process may include tasks such as color grading, audio mixing, trimming footage, adding special effects or transitions, and more. The editor will work closely with you to ensure that the final product meets your expectations and reflects your unique style and brand. Benefits of using a Professional Video Editing Service Personalization: Professional Video Editing Services offer a high degree of personalization, allowing you to tailor the editing to your specific needs and preferences. With a human editor, you have the ability to communicate directly and work collaboratively to achieve the desired outcome. Creativity: A Professional Video Editing Service can bring creativity and artistry to the editing process, making your videos stand out and engaging to your audience. They have the ability to come up with unique ideas and implement creative editing techniques that cannot be replicated by an AI tool. Quality: A Professional Video Editing Service has the experience and skills necessary to produce high-quality video content. They can ensure that your videos have professional-level color grading, audio mixing, and visual effects, resulting in a polished and engaging final product. Flexibility: A Professional Video Editing Service can adapt to your needs and make changes based on your feedback. This ensures that you are completely satisfied with the final product and that it meets your specific requirements. Limitations of using a Professional Video Editing Service Cost: Professional video editing services can be expensive, and the cost can vary depending on the complexity of the project and the level of experience and expertise of the video editor. This cost may be prohibitive for some individuals or small businesses with limited budgets. Communication: Communication between the client and the video editor is critical in ensuring that the final product meets the client‚Äôs expectations. However, sometimes miscommunication or misunderstandings may occur, which can lead to revisions and delays in the project timeline. Turnaround Time: Depending on the complexity of the project and the number of revisions required, the turnaround time for a video editing project can be lengthy. This delay can be challenging for clients who need the final video delivered within a specific timeframe. Limited Control: While clients can provide feedback and direction to the video editor, they may have limited control over the editing process. The final product may not match the client‚Äôs vision entirely, which can be frustrating for some. Security: Clients may be concerned about the security of their video footage and other confidential information that they share with the video editing service. It is essential to choose a reputable and trustworthy video editing service that prioritizes the security of their clients‚Äô data. Determining which video editing approach is best for you depends on your specific needs and circumstances. Here are some factors to consider: Time: If you need to produce video content quickly and on a tight deadline, an AI video editor may be the best choice for you. It can significantly reduce the time required for video editing. Budget: If you have a limited budget for video editing, an AI video editor may be a more cost-effective option. However, keep in mind that the quality of the final product may not be as high as that produced by a Professional Video Editing Service. Creative control: If you want complete creative control over your video content, a human video editor may be the best choice. A Professional Video Editing Service can work closely with you to understand your goals and preferences and provide personalized editing that reflects your vision. Video complexity: If your video content requires complex editing, such as visual effects or complex transitions, a Professional Video Editing Service is the best choice. AI video editors may not have the creative ability to handle these complex editing tasks. Quality: If you want the highest quality video content, a Professional Video Editing Service is the best choice. They have the experience and expertise to produce professional-level video content that engages your audience and reflects your brand effectively. Is AI or Professional Better? Both AI video editor and professional video editing services have their advantages and disadvantages for YouTube creators. While AI video editing is convenient and cost-effective, it may not always produce the desired results and lacks the creativity and personalized touch of a human editor. On the other hand, professional video editing services offer expertise, customization, and high-quality output, but can be expensive and time-consuming.
